definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: When I arrived in Yarmouth , I went straight to Barkis's house.
sentences.chinese: 到达雅茅斯后，我径直来到了巴克斯家。

sentences.english: Disasters may come straight to you , but happiness often comes in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 灾难可能是径直走到面前，可是幸福总是化妆潜来。

sentences.english: The man ran toward the emperor before falling unconscious to the ground, where he lay groaning.
sentences.chinese: 他径直向皇帝跑来，但终于不省人事跌倒了。

sentences.english: One must brush everything aside and go straight to the real problem.
sentences.chinese: 他必须扫开一切，径直走向真正的问题。

sentences.english: Whatever the re might be, " said Jukes, "we are steaming straight into it".
sentences.chinese: “不管是什么，”朱克斯说，我们都要径直行驶进去。

sentences.english: Leaf Xiao didn't answer, but the path goes straight into a sound to be like a store.
sentences.chinese: 叶萧并没有回答，而是径直走进音像店。

sentences.english: So she took the twelve shirts and went forth, and straight into the great forest.
sentences.chinese: 于是，她带上那十二件衬衣，径直向森林走去。

sentences.english: She rode up bold as you please, m'lord, demanding words with you.
sentences.chinese: 她胆大包天的径直骑了过来，大人，要求和你说话。

sentences.english: Celia looked down directly at the two executive rows.
sentences.chinese: 西莉亚双眼径直望着坐在前两排的显要人物。

sentences.english: Lily ignored them and went up to Severus.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉没理他们，径直朝西弗勒斯走去。

sentences.english: I went straight home with my daughter and we ordered a curry.
sentences.chinese: 我和女儿径直回家，点了一份咖喱粉。

sentences.english: Orpheus froze in place, but he didn't turn around.
sentences.chinese: 俄耳甫斯径直就僵在了那里，但他并没有回转身。

sentences.english: I felt now or never and went right up to him.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到机不可失，所以径直走到他面前。

sentences.english: There is a huge living room and three bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 请径直往前走，那是一个大客厅和三个卧室。

sentences.english: Tang Mingxuan in the hotel lobby to see Jie Tianjun and Ke Yuan, walked straight past.
sentences.chinese: 唐明轩在酒店大厅看到解天钧和柯媛，径直走了过去。

sentences.english: After this nice intermezzo we drive in one go all the way to Shigatze.
sentences.chinese: 在这美妙的小插曲之后，我们径直开往日喀则。

definition: to go straight to/to make a beeline for
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
